name: Hotel Casci

reviews.text: I spent a week at the Hotel Casci March 7-13, 2005. I have stayed at this hotel before, and it lived up my last impression of it, which was great. It is in an excellent location in Florence, very close to the Duomo and other attractions like the Uffizzi, Academia, Piazza della Signoria, etc.. The family who runs this hotel makes sure that you are as comfortable as possible, and always makes you feel right at home. The rooms are very quiet and adequate from a space perspective. The breakfast is good. Everyone who works at the front desk is very friendly. It is a big plus that they have a computer that you can use to get on the Internet, send/receive e-mails, etc. I highly recommend this hotel to those staying in Florence.
reviews.title: Excellent service
Perfect
reviews.text: Stay here. The location is great. Right down the street from the Duomo. The staff is wonderful. You won't find a nicer staff. The rooms are small, but not too small. We were there for part of our honeymoon. When we arrived there was a complimentary bottle of champagne, glasses and a sweet congratulatory card. Breakfast was good...standard Italian choices. The rooms were cleaned well every day. The bathroom was large enough. The price was right and you can get a discount if you pay in cash. We will definitely stay here again when visiting this great city.

I can only add to the glowing reviews this hotel has already garnered. My wife and I spent 3 days in Florence in March 2005. Upon our arrival, an unexpected pipe problem left our room without water. Rather than let us stay and be inconvenienced, the owners arranged for a transfer to another room in a hotel 2 doors down for one night. They were very apologetic, and upon our return the next day, they provided a bottle of wine for the trouble!
reviews.title: One of the very best inns I've ever been to....

reviews.text: Our room was very clean, very quiet, and very comfortable. The staff bent over backwards to be friendly and accomodating. These points alone make this a good place to stay. Breakfast is in a beautiful frescoed room, and perfectly adequate, despite the machine-made cappuccino. The hotel is located 150 yards from the Duomo - THE main attraction in town, and 150 yards in the other direction from the Accademia and THE David. The train station is 10 minute walk away.
reviews.title: Kudos to the Lombardi's

reviews.text: We've stayed in many places, and have experienced many hotels and inns. This one I recommend hands down without any doubts - I will not bother to look for any other place to stay upon my return to Florence.
reviews.title: Very happy to recommend this hotel!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is wondeful, very close to the center of Firenza. When you first arrive at the hotel you will be a little shocked as the entrance is only a dingy lobby with an elevator to the second floor where the hotel is. The owner is a very nice woman who makes sure that you get exactly what is coming to you. The rooms are very basic but very clean. The towels will also shock you as they have no fluff, but we like them so much we bought six of them at their cost. Breakfast was very good but be warned if you get near the automatic expresso maker you will have your hands cut off. (can't blame her it probably cost $10,000). The hotel recommended a couple of close restaurants that were very good (we ate at Semidivino twice). Also have them book your tickets to the Museums before you arive. Overall for the price you cannot beat Hotel Casci would definetly return but not in the summer as prices are very high and way to crowded.
reviews.title: Very Nice
The Perfect Location
reviews.text: One word of caution, if you rent a car driving around Florence is impossible. We rented one to drive to Tuscany for four days and it took me an hour to get from the Florence train station back to the car rental office which was about four blocks away. Problem is many of the streets are for taxi's and buses only so even with a good GPS I had to go totally around the city and have a someone on a scooter actually take me to the car rental return. Renting at the airport would probably have been a better idea.

We found this place listed in several guidebooks, and liked the reviews in TA. The best part was that they could accomodate our family of five adults in one very nicely sized room. The hotel is sparklingly clean, centrally located, and the room was very comfortable. You can't beat the free Wifi in every room, and the AC worked like a charm (important in July!). The best part was the family and staff that run the hotel. They are the perfect hosts, and help with everything from museum reservations ( a must) to directions. This is a very family friendly hotel in a wonderful location. We will visit them again.
reviews.title: Confortable, Clean and Cool

likes.liked: — Cool, clean room with generous bathroom

reviews.text: This hotel is about two blocks north of the Cathedral, on a busy street, but the rooms are in the back and are quiet. The air conditioning worked, a blessing since we visited in the midst of a Tuscan heat wave. A generious breakfast and free internet were welcome.
reviews.title: Great hotel, good location. friendly people

likes.liked: — the elevator, the air conditioning, the clean rooms, the friendly staff

reviews.text: Something special needs to be said about the bathrooms, our room #10 had a bidet, shower and a separate tub as well as the standard toilet and sink. You could really wash off the heat of the day.
reviews.title: Fantastic Experience, Great Location

reviews.text: This little family run hotel had everything I needed and they did everything to make your stay helpful.
reviews.title: Super helpful staff - easy location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel for three nights in late June and were very pleased with our decision. We found this hotel on TA and cancelled a previous reservation when we read the reviews for this hotel. This is a fantastic little hotel; it does not offer many frills, however, for the rate I do not believe you will find a better price in Florence.
reviews.title: Affordable, Clean, Charming, Worth Considering!

likes.liked: — The staff, clean, quiet, comfortable accomodations
likes.disliked: — Our room was without a view - a minor inconvenience as we were out all day sightseeing!

reviews.text: Upon arriving, our bags were taken to our room while we finished the paperwork; this was greatly appreciated after a long flight . The staff is professional, warm, extremely eager to please, and very helpful in all matters. Our room was of good size with ample storage opportunities for our luggage and was spotless - no room for improvement. The bed was comfortable, the room very quiet, and breakfast was served each morning. Offerings were ample and sure to please.
reviews.title: Perfecto!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We would choose this hotel again and I would recommend Hotel Casci without reservation.
reviews.title: Great place to stay

likes.disliked: — Noise of fan in bathroom and of air conditioner

reviews.text: We cannot say enough positive things about this charming hotel. The owners are tremendously caring; catering to your every need. They are thoughful and sweet, regardless of whether you are a couple on your honeymoon or a family of four. They are happy to provide directions, make dinner reservations/recommendations, schedule museum visits, and obtain ticket to concerts. One of the couples in our party of 8 had a problem with lost luggage and the owners took control by making many calls to Alitalia and perservering until the issue was resolved. The property is clean and safe, and the air conditioning works wonderfully. The location is perfect--the Duomo, Accademia, and Uffizi are just minutes away by foot. Breakfast is delicious. We shall return to Hotel Casci!
reviews.title: Good value/Location

likes.disliked: — phone would not work with phone card

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When I look for places to stay in Italy I always try to find family owned locations rather than give my money to large corporations. This hotel suited me perfectly.
reviews.title: Simple, nice and a hoenly place to stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room - Had everything I needed, everything worked, was clean and comfortable.
reviews.title: Wonderful, wonderful, hotel

likes.liked: — The owners and staff were exceptionally gracious hosts

reviews.title: Hospitality Plus
reviews.text: The hotel in general - Relaxed and comfortable atmosphere. Yes it is up a few flights of stairs, but that was no problem even after a marathon. Books and DVDs are available should you wish to spend more time in your room.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff - A family business and I can't praise the staff enough. We were made to feel very welcome and help was given on everything we asked for. The staff really made the stay worthwhile and provided a good camaraderie between the clients. The staff even prepared breakfast early on Sunday morning for a number of us competing in the marathon.
reviews.title: Loved the Casci

reviews.text: Location - You can walk everywhere you need in Florence from here. Very close the SM station and bus stops.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Casci and its staff

likes.liked: — The wonderful who owned and worked in the hotel.

reviews.text: My wife, myself, and our sixteen year old daughter spent four nights at the Hotel Casci during the first week of April. We shared a triple room - a king bed and a double bed. The room was simple, but quite spacious, and extremely clean. There was adequate storage space, and the bathroom was small but very functional. The location of the hotel was perfect for us - two blocks from the Duomo, but not in the midst of the hoards of tourists. EVERYTHING was an easy walk away - the train station, the Duomo, all the major galleries, and the river. All of the staff were unbelievably kind and accomodating, most notably Paolo and Pierpaolo. Everybody spoke English flawlessly and a number of other languages as well. Prior to our visit, Pierpaolo made reservations for us at the Uffizi and the Accademia which obviated waiting in the long lines we had heard about. Breakfast was simple but more than adequate. When we return to Florence, we certainly consider staying at the Hotel Casci again.
reviews.title: A delightful friendly little hotel

likes.liked: — friendly staff who were extremely helpful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was our second stay at the Casci and we could not be more pleased. Our room and bathroom were immaculate and the buffet breakfast is excellent. What makes the Casci so special, however, is the personal care given to the place and the guests by the wonderful family who runs it. They really make you feel special--as if you were a part of the family. They love Florence and know it so well that they can provide answers to just about any question anyone might have! We also loved the face/hand towels. My Dad used to use that kind of towel. They are very absorbent and light and we went out and bought some to bring home. On our next trip to Florence, we'll be back at the Casci!
reviews.title: We wouldn't stay anywhere else in Florence!

likes.liked: — The family who runs it, the cleanliness of the accommodations, the buffet breakfast and the location
likes.disliked: — The elevator in the building is very tiny.

reviews.text: My mother and I stayed here for two nights in April 2007. It was my third stay.
reviews.title: Another great stay at the Casci

likes.liked: — cleanliness, , very nice welcome and attention, endless supply of cappucino at breakfast

reviews.text: I can't really add anything to what has already been stated, except that I wouldn't stay anywhere else. Spotlessly clean, quiet, comfortable hotel, a two star with added extras, like the free internet, ample supply of travel books in the lobby, great cappuccino at breakfast (always ready to give you more), and the always pleasant and helpful Lombardi family, who were even able to fulfill my request for room no. 10! (ask for this one - four windows, (one in the bathroom), a large entryway and a newly-renovated bathroom with separate shower and large soaker tub).
reviews.title: Loved the Casci

reviews.text: This is a well-loved and cared-for property, and it shows. I hope to return to this hotel and this great city.
reviews.title: Very comfortable, well located, clean hotel

reviews.text: I wish we had more time in Florence to enjoy our stay at the Hotel Casci. The hotel is in a very central location with the Accademia being 2 mins away along with the San Lorenzo flea market, the Uffizi, the Duomo, etc. Our room was big along with our bathroom (a sunken tub)- the only drawback was that we couldn't figure out how to operate the AC which we could have asked the front desk however it was past 1:00 a.m and we didn't want to disturb our hosts. We opened the window and we were comfortable. Our hosts provided us with a great restaurant where we were treated well for a change (see my post on not visiting Italy) and the food was also tasty. If I ever return to Italy, I would definitely return to Florence and Hotel Casci.
reviews.title: Great Location, room, and people
Definitely 2 star
reviews.text: As a regular hotel stayer through business demands, I wasn't sure this was the hotel for me and my husband, given the pictures on the internet. However the room rate (over £100 per night) and the rating and reviews on this site meant I booked a double room for 2 days. The rooms are as pictured on it's own internet site- basic. It is well located, clean and with staff who speak very good english with lots of travel information and free internet access. However, I wasn't happy with my choice. We moved rooms as the first one was small, noisy and dark with a bathroom so small it was difficult to move round, and in 'complaining' we seemed to upset the staff. We felt we were intruding at breakfast and looked at other hotel options. It is difficult to find a good value hotel in Florence but I wouldn't recommend this one. It's been a year and I still feel compelled to write this review and point out is is definitely a 2star despite the rave reviews on this site.

This is the first review I have written on TripAdvisor, and I am doing so simply to pass on how good Hotel Casci is. We stayed there for a 3 day break in March. It is very conveniently located - a short walk to the main tourist attractions. The rooms were well equipped and very clean. It was excellent value, particularly when compared to other European city hotels I have stayed in recently. The main reason to stay there though is the friendly family who run it and the excellent service they provide. They made us feel so welcome and were always happy to provide advice and assistance (eg making a restaurant reservation, booking a taxi etc). The free internet access in the reception area was a bonus.
reviews.title: Superb, friendly hotel

reviews.text: I would be very happy to return to Florence and stay in the Hotel Casci again.
reviews.title: Low-Cost Gem
Home away from Home
reviews.text: Although its been several years since I last stayed at the Hotel Casci, it is clear that very little has changed. The location remains wonderful, but so does the staff. Its nice when a small-family hotel is able to maintain its top-tier rating year-in and year-out

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It has taken us way too long to find the time to write this review of our excellent stay at the Hotel Casci. We must echo many of the reviewers that the hospitality shown by Paolo and the hotel staff is first class and by the end of a few days you will wish you could have stayed there longer especially when you move to your next hotel and realize that it is not the norm. The hotel is very clean and the rooms are large by European standards. The A/C was perfect to cool down after a long day walking in the heat of Florence and the close location to many sights and restaurants was a surprise with the economical price of this hotel. We will miss our afternoon happy hours with Paolo and wish him the best.
reviews.title: A hotel that will make your trip to Florence a pleasure

likes.liked: — Paolo and hotel staff who went above and beyond to make us feel at home in Florence

reviews.text: Tom & Angie Thompson
reviews.title: Can't go wrong with the Hotel Casci

reviews.text: Loveland, OH
reviews.title: A Wonderful Family Hotel

reviews.text: WOW!! I can't believe this hotel! Very central location, amazing service, clean, big room, yet only rated as a 2 star?! You've got to be kidding! This hotel was awesome. We arrived early in the morning from Rome by train, and they let us keep our bags by the front desk until the regular afternoon check in time, so we had time for a side trip to Pisa. When we got back, our bags were already in our room (number 15, if I recall) and the A/C was on for us! Paolo at the front desk is a very charming, affable and thoughtful hotelier. He clearly loves what he does, and his helpfulness makes it a very enjoyable stay for all concerned. The complimentary breakfast the next morning was excellent. My kids asked about hot chocolate, and voila, they made some for both of them even though it wasn't there put out with all the other breakfast items. The only drawback is that it is not right at street level, you have to take an elevator up 2 stories, or else the stairs. The elevator is very tiny, so if there are more than 2 of you with bags, best to have one person take the stairs because you won't all fit.
reviews.title: Super place to stay in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our stay in Florence was wonderful! We stayed and the Hotel Casci which was perfectly situated close to everything we wanted to see and do. My favorite place to shop - the market - was just around the corner! The owners of the Casci were gracious and very accommodating - always kind and wearing a smile; and the facilities were clean and comfortable. It was nice having a computer in the lounge area to check email and find information. Breakfast was always enjoyable as we visited with the other guests and talked about their travels and plans for the day.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Casci!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is a gem! We stayed a week. Absolutely comfortable, clean, quiet, convenient. The Lombardi Family could not have been more gracious, helpful and just wonderful people. They had the best recommendations for meals. Extensive library of travel books and materials. Can't wait to stay there again.
reviews.title: What a find!
Fabulous Find!
reviews.text: found out later that my brother and his wife had also stayed there a year previously. We were all talking about "this great small place in Florence" and found out we had all stayed at Hotel Casci and so enjoyed it.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Located in the heart of Florence, near the Duomo and practically next door to the Medici Palace, the Hotel Casci was recommended to me by two fellow American academics. It is excellent in every way -- spacious, clean, and charmingly decorated rooms and a very congenial atmosphere! The family members in charge speak perfect English and French (and no doubt German and other languages) and are extremely pleasant and helpful. They are clearly committed to insuring that their guests have smooth and enjoyable visits. All the staff members were cheerful and courteous, and I enjoyed all the other guests I met while there. I look forward to returning with my family for a longer stay sometime soon.
reviews.title: A Perfect City Break

reviews.text: Having enjoyed a stay at the Casci a few years ago, we decided to go back for a short break in Florence. The hotel is situated really close to the main sights but the rooms are quiet. The Casci is run by a delightful family who cannot do enough for you. They are most welcoming, charming and helpful. They all speak good English. The hotel does not have a restaurant (it does do a buffet breakfast) but will recommend places for you, arrange taxis, trips or whatever you want . We had an excellent, large en-suite room. It is dead easy to book through the hotel website (www.hotelcasci.com) and you will immediately receive a friendly response giving all the information you need. Off season rate was very good indeed - a miracle for Florence.
reviews.title: Great Location - Very Accomodating

reviews.text: What a perfect Hotel to stay at for my first visit to Florence! Your
reviews.title: A gem of a family run hotel!

likes.disliked: — Shower needs a shower curtain, it's typical European open style

reviews.text: Sorry I haven't written since my visit. This has been my first chance to write. From what I remember, this hotel was just right. It is conveniently located to the tourist sites. The serveice was excellent. They recommended one of the best restaurants I have ever eaten at. The breakfast was fine. They also helped us with our budget by placing us in a family room instead of 2 rooms. You will not go wrong with this place.
reviews.title: Perfect Location

reviews.text: Hope this helps.
reviews.title: Everything written already is true!

reviews.text: The family that runs the hotel- FABULOUS!!!!!!! The best in the business!
reviews.title: Great stay at the Casci.

reviews.text: Will help with anything and everything!
reviews.title: Hotel Casci.... the place to stay in central Florence.

reviews.text: The location- can't be beat!!!!!!
reviews.title: Family Friendly
A first-class, family-run operation
reviews.text: My wife and I, and our two kids (ages 10 & 13) stayed at the hotel for three nights in mid-May, 2007 and were extremely impressed by the quality of the experience that this family-run hotel was able to provide for us. Our quad room was clean, modern, air-conditioned and it offered us plenty of room in which to move around (a rarity in our european experience). Breakfast was plentiful and delicious - fruit, brioche, toast, granola, bran, yoghurts, orange juice and steaming hot cappucino served by the family matriarch herself. The lobby has free internet access. Rooms have wi-fi access. And the shelves behind the front desk are absolutely crammed with (mostly english) guidebooks of the area. It's just a block away from the Duomo, and (for the smart packers) a simple walk to or from the train station. No hesitation whatsoever in recommending this hotel to anyone.
The rooms were clean, comfortable and lovely to look at. Breakfast was wonderful. And most of all the staff was thoroughly accomodating and helpful. Three thumbs up!
reviews.title: Charming personal service at Hotel Casci

reviews.text: My family and I stayed at Hotel Casci for three nights in April 2007. Our room (one king and one twin bed) was very comfortable. We were treated exceptionally well by the owners, who arranged tickets to the Accademia and Uffizi, on short notice. Breakfast was outstanding. The location could not have been better. There is no reason to stay anywhere else in Florence. We will return as soon as we can, and stay longer.
reviews.title: Hotel Casci is outstanding!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in this excellent 2 star hotel in Feb 07. It surely can’t be beaten on location, value for money and cleanliness. We had quite a small room with tiny bathroom (including a pull-down toilet!) but it was spotless and the bed was so comfortable. Considering the location it was also very quiet. We didn’t think the staff were over-friendly, in fact they seemed a bit stressed!, but we never really asked them for anything. We booked direct via their website and saved money paying in cash. Their e-mails were extremely friendly and helpful. The breakfast was adequate – and they arranged a super-early one for us on the morning we left, which was great. Would definitely recommend it.
reviews.title: Can't be beaten

reviews.text: Like the other reviewers, we were most impressed by the helpfulness and warmth of Paolo, his mom and Pierpaolo. Paolo can give you advice on where to go, when and how, especially if you want to go beyond the obvious attractions in Firenze. The location is perfect --we were with our two teenage daughters and ultimately let them go off on their own because the hotel became like a home to return to. Take advantage of the paid parking Casci offers if you have a car because you don't want to drive in town. The rooms were nice and clean; only complaint was that in our inner courtroom room, the air conditioner didn't cool too well and the window was in a place that we didn't get a full breeze. But I did see a bat hunting for dinner one night in the small atrium. When we returned home, one of my daughters said she wished she was back in the breakfast room with Paolo's mom offering her another capuccino. A wonderful place.
reviews.title: Casci is warm and friendly

reviews.text: We stayed at the Casci for 3 nights in April and had a wonderful time and echo the sentiments shared by many in other reviews of the Hotel Casci. Paolo and his family are very customer service oriented and go out the way to make sure you have a good stay and are as comfortable as possible. My family of 4 stayed in a spacious room that was very comfortable. The hotels location is central to all of the main Florence sights and the train station. We enjoyed our access to the public computer so we could check e-mail over the course of our stay. We would strongly encourage anyone to stay at the Casci while in Florence.
reviews.title: Great hotel to stay at while in Florence

likes.liked: — The customer service of the staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband & I stayed over our wedding anniversary weekend & it was perfect - really helpful & welcoming.. Fantastic Location which allows you to spend 2 or 3 hours out walking & sight seeing & then return for a rest before you go again! The Owner was so friendly & couldn't have made us feel more welcome. Free internet & also wi-fi around the hotel. Rooms are simple & ours was on the small side, but quiet (he remembered we'd requested that). Booking directly was an advantage because they also offered to book tickets for the Ufizzi & L'Academia in advance & we were SO pleased that they'd suggested that becaues the queues were miles long!
reviews.title: Friendly, Relaxed & Super!

reviews.text: What a great little hotel! We had 6 people (3 rooms) and every single person thought it was a true gem. Though the hotel itself is fairly small and located on the 2F, the location is perfect for sightseeing in Florence - an easy 5 minute walk to about all of the major attractions in the central district. The rooms are very comfortable and fairly large considering the location and age of the property. The bathrooms are very modern and spotless - we even had towel wamers and bidets. The rooms include modern flat screen TVs and all rooms have free access to WiFi internet. The lobby has a large selection of travel books that make planning sightseeing and side trips easy. The breakfasts are great with an assortment of fruit, bread, cereal, eggs and cheese. But - the absolute best thing about the hotel are the hosts. It is a family run property and EVERYONE becomes an instant friend! They go out of their way to make your stay enjoyable and you really do feel like you're leaving behind a friend when the day comes to check out.
reviews.title: Great find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Based our hotel decision in Florence solely on the rave reviews found here on tripadvisor.com--and they were spot on. Hotel Casci is a delight. European simple (actually, the rooms are rather spacious compared to most), moderately priced, clean, modern bathrooms, flat screen TV, internet, fabulous location, good breakfast, etc. But without doubt the BEST feature are the hosts. Quite simply, Paolo and family get it. Service, attention, kindness, efficiency, all going the extra mile, from Paolo himself to the night desk managers, at any hour, to the cheerful service staff. We were in and out of Florence for ten days, and during our absences our remaining bags were stored then transferred and waiting for us in our new rooms on each of our returns. One night, our daughter (studying in Florence for the semester) joined us, which Paolo graciously allowed with no objection (imagine that in a U.S. hotel...). And everyone seemed to be up to speed on the details of our comings and goings. Paolo even helped me locate a doctor to treat my uncomfortable sinus infection. Don't be putt off by the ancient elevator or the third floor lobby, Casci is a find and will be our hotel of choice for our future Florence visits.
reviews.title: Hotel Casci's a Gem
Great hotel
reviews.text: We loved everything about Hotel Casci. The family/staff is welcoming and eager to help with reservations and suggestions. There is free wi-fi and also a computer in the lobby, a library of paperbacks previous visitors have left (what a great idea!), and a location central to everything in Florence. Our room was large and had a large bathroom; a friend staying at the same time had a tiny room but with a nice balcony. Rooms have flat screen TVs and a safe, and are kept immaculately clean. The breakfast -hard boiled eggs, fruit, pastry etc is fine. We would definitely return.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Run by a lovely family (and very cute PierrePaulo!), they couldn't have been more helpful. They obtained advance reservations for us at Uffizi and Academia. Our room was not large, but cleverly outfitted, with great spots for luggage, desk, storage, etc. The room even had a separate little area for reading, with its own TV. And the best bathroom of our trip! The towels are a little different, not fluffy, but they did the job. No washcloth, but I guess that's common. Our room was quiet and wonderfully dark for sleeping. They recommended great restaurants (Za Za!!), and happily made reservations for us.
reviews.title: A Great Find

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Contrary to other reviewers, our experience with Hotel Cacsi was disappointing. Perhaps our expectations for a two-star hotel were too high. The front of the building was shrouded in scaffolding, which did not help first impressions; likewise the fact that the hotel is on the second floor, albeit with lift access.
reviews.title: Disappointed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms are spacious but sparsely furnished, so we could not unpack properly. Our friends were given a room with only a small window and no outlook, so after some remonstrance another room was found for them.
reviews.title: Best Location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The staff were friendly and very helpful, but the proprietress seemed to rule the breakfast room with an iron fist!
reviews.title: Weekend Break in Florence

reviews.text: The best thing about the hotel is probably the location - very central, close to many tourist spots, and surrounded by restaurants.
reviews.title: Would return there in a heartbeat.

likes.disliked: — Not being able to completely close window to keep mosquitos out.

reviews.title: Great Florence Hotel
reviews.text: This little charmer is a great find. The staff is very accomodating, friendly and they speak great english. The location is great.

reviews.title: A place you would want to come back
reviews.text: My room was room 2 which is on the reception floor overlooking the main street. The only slight problem was the street noise if I had the windows open. Otherwise they have great thick windows which if shut block out the sound. The included breakfast is good and overall, for the price, you wont find much better.
I came to this site with an intention to share with other travellers this nice hotel, just only to find that other reviews had already filled this hotel up with compliments!
reviews.title: Great choice

reviews.text: I stayed at Hotel Casci for only one night but it is enough to make me so impressed.
reviews.title: Excellent in every way
Outstanding hotel and staff
reviews.text: The two best things to highlight for Hotel Casci are the hospitality and the location. I have never found such a warm hospitality and care from any of European hotels like this place. The Lombardi family treats their guests like their family's guest.. especially at breakfast where the food is not luxury but plentiful and the hotel owner will greet you there with a cup of coffee. The hotel is in a great location, about 200 meters to the Duomo, same for Galleria Academia where Michaelangelo's David is. Also in a walk distance to Central Train Station.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We spent three nights here the first week in September, and were pleased to find it so conveniently located just a few hundred yards from the Duomo and within walking distance of other sites and the station. Although the hotel entrance is on a busy street, the rooms are on the second floor (there is a lift if you need it) and extend back from the street so you look out on to courtyards. Also they have double glazing so they are very quiet. When we were there there was building work going on but that didn't start till 8 am and was over by the time we returned to the hotel at 4 or 5 pm so, apart from a bit of dust in the street entrance, it didn't affect us. The room was spacious, and there was a large bathroom. The room had its own air conditioning, which made a hum that was a bit noticeable at night, but only what you'd expect. The towels were changed daily and the sheets were changed after two days. The toiletries were kept well supplied. Our room and all the public areas of the hotel were kept immaculately clean.
reviews.title: Outstanding welcome

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The breakfast, included in the price, is self-service and, contrary to what a recent review has stated, we helped ourselves to whatever we wanted, but we were also served coffee by the staff and offered second cups by them. Although there is an extensive range of foods on offer we noticed that some fellow-guests who had particular wishes for something not available were provided with what they needed.
reviews.title: A great few days but marred by noisy building works

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel has many advantages but its outstanding feature is the friendliness of its staff, not just the owner and his family but all the staff. Advance reservations for galleries, table bookings for restaurants, advice and information on all aspects of visiting Florence, were freely offered and they seemed genuinely concerned to ensure that we had a successful and enjoyable stay. In our quite extensive experience of hotels, a welcome and helpfulness of this level is rare.
reviews.title: Superb Casci.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As there are a great number of hotels in Florence we researched extensively before deciding upon the Casci, which was rated highly in both the Lonely Planet Guide and on trip advisor. On arrival, after a short walk from the train station, we were somewhat surprised at the entrance off the street, which was clad in scaffolding and appeared to be in a poor state of repair.
reviews.title: Friendly Hotel with a Smile

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were greeted by extremely friendly staff and shown to our room which was smaller than we'd anticipated, but its location more than made up for this. The hotel is situated within a 5 minute walk of the Duomo and other central attractions of Florence and couldn't have been better placed.
reviews.title: An exquisite gem in Florence!

reviews.text: The Hotel Casci was great. You can’t beat the location, and the helpfulness of the staff was fantastic. The location is very centrally located, literally a five minute walk to the Academia and David, and just a 10-15 minute easy walk to everywhere else you would want to go. Once I booked my reservations at the hotel, the staff offered to make museum reservations for us which we gladly took them up on. (I highly recommend this.) Then once at the hotel, they were very helpful. They recommended a restaurant to us that turned out to be the best restaurant we ate at in Italy, and that’s saying a lot since every restaurant was great. But Il Semidivino, just a five minute walk from Hotel Casci, was by far the best. (It was so good, we didn’t take a chance on anything less, and ate there both nights we were in Florence.)
reviews.title: Highly Recommend Hotel Casci

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Everything else about the Hotel Casci was very good also – the food in the morning, the room itself was quite spacious, and even the internet access was convenient. But again I have to comment on the staff – very helpful, but I assure you, not overbearing in the least – just very helpful if you needed them in any way. I highly recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Wonderful Stay in Florence
Casci in the heart of Florence
reviews.text: We stayed for a week at the Hotel Casci in mid April and can thoroughly recommend the hotel from every point of view. Our large room was very clean and very quiet, even though the hotel is on a main road. The location is excellent with pretty much everywhere being within walking distance. The staff were welcoming and very helpful. They booked our tickets for the Uffizi and Accademia which was great as it avoided a 2 hour wait in the queue outside! The buffet breakfast was fine, with a good variety to help yourself to, plus cappuccino, coffee and proper pots of tea!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The city sight-seeing bus is worth doing for an overview of the sights. Do stop off at Fiesole if you can; we did on a beautiful warm day and walked up to the top and had lunch in a small restaurant overlooking the stunning view of the city. Absolutely idyllic!! Also, go to the Duomo in the afternoon, the morning queues to get in had all disappeared by then.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: We would definitely stay at the Hotel Casci again and would recommend it to anyone.
reviews.title: Great location and great staff
Hotel Casci is the best bet the right price!
reviews.text: The extremely friendly and helpful staff made our stay in Florence hassel-free and a true pleasure. This hotel is an outstanding value for a reasonable price.

reviews.title: Fine Hotel with excellent staff, nice rooms and good location
reviews.text: Hotel Casci helped make Florence an enjoyable experience. The hotel is on a main street , but the rooms are quiet and well set out for the price. I stayed in 7 hotels in Italy during a five week vacation and this hotel provided the best value for your money.

reviews.title: Felt like Family
reviews.text: The staff was particularly helpful and the breakfasts were good. The location is also good. The lobby served drinks, beer and soft drinks at all hours. I highly recommend this hotel and would stay there again.

This was by far our favorite hotel in Italy. Reason being that the staff were just so friendly and helpful. The rooms were beautiful, big and clean. The location was excelent - very close to markets, duomo, ponte vec, shops etc. Breakfast was fun (we met someone new everyday) and the complementry internet and the wash by the load laundry facilities was just so helpful to us. Thank you Hotel Casci!!!
reviews.title: Inviting and attentive
A Great Hotel with Great Staff and Location
reviews.text: I spent three nights at Hotel Casci. Even prior to arrival, Paolo helped me to make museum reservations, enabling me to avoid long lines at places like the Uffizi and the Accademia. The hotel has a great location near the Duomo. My room was quiet and the air conditioning kept me comfortable in the hot weather. Staying here was very much like staying at a bed and breakfast: Paolo and company went out of their way to make me feel welcome in Florence. Additional perks: the library of guide books at the front desk and the computer for internet use.

What a delight to find this small hotel so centrally located for our three days in Florence. My daughter and I easily walked from the train station to the hotel, with excellent directions from Mr. Lombardi. The hotel is walkably close to the Duomo, markets, museums, and restaurants. Our hosts also made our reservations at the Accademia and the Uffizi, so we didn’t have to wait long in line. Our room was spacious and clean with crisp white linens and comfortable beds. We enjoyed the ample breakfast fare with local pastries, the wonderful coffee, and the helpful library of travel books and maps. A pleasant, gracious staff made us feel like family. Many of our fellow-guests shared our favorable opinion of Hotel Casci. I would definitely stay there again. The only downside was that our room could have used a little more heat, since November nights can be a little chilly.
reviews.title: Convenient location, gracious hosts

reviews.text: My family and I (wife: 36; son: 15 months; me: 37) stayed at the Hotel Casci for eight nights in November, 2007. It was our first trip abroad with our son, and we were somewhat nervous about how he would adapt to the rigors of travel (and whether he would drive everyone else around us insane). Our worries were for naught -- the trip was fantastic, and our stay at Casci played a big part in making it so. The following are our thoughts on a thoroughly enjoyable stay:
reviews.title: Perfect choice for the Budget Conscious - Superb

reviews.text: LOCATION: Tough to beat; the hotel is approx. 3 blocks from the Duomo. It's also just a few blocks from the Accademia & the Medici Chapels, to name a few more sites, and it's approx. a 10-minute walk from the train station and bus depots.
reviews.title: We loved Hotel Casci...pass the hot chocolate.

likes.liked: — Comfortable, friendly, felt like I had a family for a week.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: OUR ROOM: clean, updated, with ample space; large double-bed; plenty of closet space, TV w/ remote & major international news channels in a variety of languages; the room was well-maintained and cleaned by the staff daily. Our room was very quiet, but it was to the rear of the hotel, so we can't comment on whether traffic noise is an issue. The hotel apparently has Wi-Fi in all the rooms, as well as air-conditioning.
reviews.title: Great Value
Fantastic Location!
reviews.text: OUR BATHROOM: large, well-lit; excellent shower & bathtub with plenty of hot water; contemporary sink, toilet & bidet (if that's important to you); sufficient shelf space.
The hotel was very nice and the staff was excellent. Very kind and helpful
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I would describe this hotel as more of a hostel. Free internet in the bar area (wi-fi for laptop users), common dining area, simply furnished.
reviews.title: Convenient and Affordable

reviews.text: However, our room was the most spacious of all the hotels we stayed in during our trip through northern Italy. The convenient location adjacent to the duomo was great.
reviews.title: Heart of the Historic Centre

likes.liked: — Friendly, helpful staff, position, buffet breakfast, clean rooms.

reviews.text: The staff was extremely friendly and very helpful.
reviews.title: Great Staff

reviews.text: My only complaint is that the air freshener or cleaning agent they used in our room had a very strong odor. We needed to keep the window open to air out the room.
reviews.title: A Gem amongst many in Florence

reviews.text: We returned today from Florence and the Hotel Casci. We do normally stay in a hotel with a higher star value. However,this hotel came highly reccommended by reviewers on Slow travel so we decided to try it. We were not disappointed.
reviews.title: Excellent centrally located hotel with lovely staff.

reviews.text: The staff are the main asset of this hotel,very friendly and helpful but not intrusive. Nothing is too much trouble for them. Train timetables,taxis,museum reservations,bus tours,etc etc you name it they can, and do, sort it!!!!
reviews.title: Most memorable stay...

reviews.text: We had the room at the back of the hotel,quite a trek from the front desk but a nice,spotlessly clean room and decently sized bathroom. Here I will mention the towels.......we would have preferred fluffy,had we known they had them....maybe it would be an idea to ask guests or have a mixture of each available?? Breakfast was nice,great coffee and an egg boiling device!!,enough choice for everyone,even our sometimes picky son.
reviews.title: Pretty Good
Great Hotel, Great Location
reviews.text: We loved the location of the hotel,close to almost everything and within walking distance of the main sights. The facade of the hotel is still covered with scaffolding,but as with all buildings if repairs need to be done,so be it,. it does not detract from the hotel experience. The bottom line is that this is a very centrally located hotel at a great price,with a wonderful ambience and certainly worth trying for yourself.

Our stay in Firenze and at the Hotel Casci was one of the highlights of our recent trip to Tuscany and central and southern Italy. The amazing hospitality, caring and helpfulness of Paolo and his family will always be remembered by us. Our family felt as though we were truly guests in a friend's palazzo - which is what Hotel Casci actually is. The breakfasts were more like feasts unparalled with any other of our stays in Italy. Wonderful, spotless rooms with charm aplenty. All this, in walking distance from the Duomo, Uffizi, L'Accademia, quaint trattorias and the train station was more than we could have asked for. We would stay with Paolo again in a hearbeat and can't wait to schedule our next trip to Firenze and Hotel Casci.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Hotel Casci
reviews.text: My husband and I stayed at the hotel casci in mid June 2007 we had a wonderful stay, the rooms were spotless with towels changed daily, service warm and friendly and breakfast excellent.

reviews.title: Lovely refined family hotel
reviews.text: We made use of the valet parking service where by hotel staff park your car and when you want to use it they bring it to your hotel. This was well worth the extra cost and made driving less stressful. It was a nice touch by the hotel to be given a calender of views of Tuscany at the end of the stay. We will definetly stay at that hotel when we return to Florence.

reviews.title: Fantastic Hosts
reviews.text: My one complaint of establishments outside of the hotel was the poor service we received and the lack of a smile on the faces of the staff serving us. They sat England is bad for service but I would place Florence much higher on the list . The exception to the bad service was in the Irish bar which was ran by oriential sstaff and they were very welcoming and always had a smile and a frienly manner.

reviews.title: Good value
reviews.text: My husband and I had a lovely stay at this hotel. The family are very welcoming and do their very best to assist with requests. The lady supervising the breakfast is a charming host and very refined and unobstrusive.The manager and deputies were most helpful in all aspects,especially when we had to arrange a flight from Greece to the UK for our daughter

reviews.title: A Great Place to Stay!
reviews.text: Cleaners exceptional.

reviews.title: A "Best Bet" in Florence
reviews.text: I don't believe you will find a better hotel for the money in Florence! I just got back a couple of weeks ago, and I am getting ready to book this hotel again. It is just a block or so from the Duomo, close to the SMN train station, immaculately clean with a friendly and caring staff that couldn't have been more helpful. You will not be disappointed.

reviews.title: Great Location
reviews.text: We stayed here March 12th to the 15th and had a wonderful stay. The rooms were clean and comfortable but the shower needed more water pressure. The hotel staff were very helpful, breakfast was good, and the free computer terminal was a plus. The location was the best feature, very close to all of Florence's sights.

reviews.title: Service and location!
reviews.text: This small hotel is centrally located in Florence to all major attractions. The rooms are average sized, and modestly furnished, but absolutely spotless! You stay here for the service! The Lombardi family couldn't do enough for us! On the last day, we had an early flight (prior to breakfast hours) and they had breakfast waiting for us at the front desk. Breakfast every morning was great as well.

reviews.title: Interesting Hotel
reviews.text: I think what turned my wife on when we arrived after a train ride down from Bolzano was the free internet access. The staff were very friendly and a very nice breakfast was included in the in the price of 120 Euro per night for a 2-night stay, (1 and 2 November). Hard-boiled eggs were provided, but they did have boiling water to cook soft-boiled eggs if desired. You are within walking distance of most of the interesting sites.

reviews.title: Friendly - Great Location
reviews.text: On check out we needed a taxi and they had one arrive within 2 minutes and was waiting for us downstairs when we went out the door.

The hotel is perfectly located; one can walk everywhere. Staff members (mostly family) are welcoming, friendly, helpful with even the smallest detail and ready to recommend shops, museums and restaurants. Rooms are comfortably furnished, with windows that open (best to be on the courtyard side). Wi-fi works well. Great value for price and the bonus is how warm the reception is. Recommended for single women traveling alone -- as well as anyone else.
reviews.title: Wonderful stay at wonderful hotel.

reviews.text: We were so comfortable in this hotel. The staff are warm, helpful accomodating. The hotel rooms are immaculate. Our room was facing a courtyard at the backside of the hotel. It was an adequate size for two people and the bathroom was quite large. The location is perfect. One block from the Academia where the statue of David is housed. Two blocks from the Duomo. Two blocks from the Mercardo Central - Lorenzo Market. a few blocks from Piazza Signoria. It was perfect. Lots of restaurants in the Mercardo area. The breakfast was a perfect European style with fresh Cappucino. It was cozy, the staff was helpful and informative. They provide the guests with free DVD movies, they have a library of guide books for their guests to use. It is obvious that the goal of the Casci Hotel staff is to make their guests as comfortable as possible. They even helped us figure out how to operate our new camera. The overall hotel was immaculately clean, the location was perfect. All combined, this experience help to make our 3 day stay in Florence, a perfect one.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: Hotel Casci is a wonderful place to stay in a great location. The location makes it very easy to explore the beautiful city of Florence, with the train station a short walk away, the bus stop across the street and the main sites and shopping close by. I have stayed at Hotel Casci 4 times over the past 9 years while traveling with friends/family or on my own. The hospitality is second to none and the rooms are great. The breakfast is terrific, especially the capuccino! Restaurant recommendations or assistance with museum tickets is always available and provided with a smile. Great place to stay!!
reviews.title: Great Location and Hospitality
Location, Location
reviews.text: For the Lombardi family who run this hotel, nothing is too much trouble for their guests. They were genuinely so helpful in every respect. The breakfasts were extremely good and wonderful cappucino, made with freshly ground coffee beans. Great!! I would recommend this hotel to anyone wanting good value for money in the centre of Florence. The hotel's location was within a very short walk of the Duomo, Uffizi and Accademia Gallery. We had our Gallery tickets booked for us in advance by the hotel, which saved us valuable time. Also close by were the leather markets and some of the good shopping streets of Florence. A leisurely 10 minute walk will find you at the Ponte Vecchio bridge. Good Trattoria recommendations were given for evening meals.
Jacqui & Michael
reviews.title: Home Away From Home

likes.liked: — The staff, location, and cleanliness of the facility

reviews.text: Don't be misled by the 15th century palazzo publicity. This is an overpriced and poky place. The entrance is scruffy and depressing. The room was expensive-110 euros, it was so poky that we could hardly walk round the beds and the bathroom was so small it was necessary to keep the door open to avoid claustrophia. Breakfast was very basic. You could do so much better for the price. Also, the rooms are off a winding warren of a corridor that is airless and depressing.
reviews.title: Poky and overpriced

likes.disliked: — depressing building, scruffy entrance, poky room, very overpriced

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This delightful small family owned hotel in Florence was one of the highlights of our Italian visit. The family could not have been any more helpful and the breakfast provied was great. The hotel was a short walk from the major tourist sites and only 12 Euros by cab from the train station. Hotel was on the first floor but there is the usual small lift. They also have a small bar at the reception which was a good spot to relax and meet other travellers. The room was small but very clean.
reviews.title: Florence Gem

reviews.text: Very close to the Doumo; Clean; Very personable service; good breakfast; firm beds; air conditioning. We really enjoyed our stay. Modest hotel with great service.
reviews.title: Very Nice - all the way around

reviews.text: Just got back from two nights at the Hotel Casci and loved it! You will like it too. How do I know? Because there is nothing not to like! The staff is friendly and helpful (they made our dinner/museum reservations and called for taxis). The location is right in the heart of Florence (about halfway between the Duomo and the Accademia Museum). The breakfast is plentiful and tasty. The rooms are clean, air conditioned and very spacious -- the bathroom, including the shower, are also large. There is free internet access and an elevator. As I said, what's not to like?
reviews.title: Best Value in Florence

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: An absolute gem of a hotel! Extremely friendly and very helpful staff. Clean,comfortable room. Comfortable bed with fresh sheets everyday.Secure safe in the room for your valuables.Plenty of choice for breakfast.Hotel is located within 500m of the Duomo and within easy walking distance of all the major sights.If you can't be without the internet there is even free access in the bar. Will we stay there again-Yes!!!
reviews.title: Loved it!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we booked our stay via the hotel's website to the moment we checked out after a five night stay we experienced wonderful friendly and efficient service.
reviews.title: Great hotel in a great location

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel is located in an ideal position to explore Florence with all the major attractions only a few minutes walk from the hotel. The breakfasts were great with a wide variety of food on offer.
reviews.title: Awesome

reviews.text: We had booked a double room but ended up staying in a triple room which was spacious and clean.
reviews.title: Great surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We highly recommend this hotel and will definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Hotel Casci - A Home Away from Home
Great hotel and staff!
reviews.text: Look, it's not the Ritz, but who cares...Luxuries be damned, and fancy breakfast be damned. (Seriously, you're in Italy. Skip breakfast and focus on lunch and dinner. Find yourself some good restaurants. I hear that Italy has a few.) If you're in the same boat we were in, you're looking for an inexpensive room that's clean, comfortable, and well located. Hotel Casci is all of those things and then some.

reviews.title: Good for the rating
reviews.text: Hotel Casci was an enjoyable stay for a family run property of the star rating that it has. I will admit that I generally do stay in 'large chain' hotels of a 4star rating or there abouts, so Hotel Casci for me was something different to what I am used to. However, bearing in mind that I have no other properties of the same type/standard to compare it to, I can only imagine that it is much better than some others out there as the property was always clean and the staff friendly. Even if, at times, you felt like you were being 'watched' in a way. The elderly lady (never grabbed her name) is the nicest staff members. Paolo is also nice, but sometimes 'over the top', so to speak.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our room was nothing flashy, but somewhere to lay our head, even if the bed was a little hard. The bathroom was very small however, sitting on the loo my knees touched the wall infront of me! There was some scaffolding and construction going on outside, meaning that we could not open the shutters on our windows. When we first arrived and tried to open the window, the shutters barely opened before banging into the scaffoling that was right outside our window. This mean that the room was dark and lights always had to be on. We also couldn't leave the window open for what little air could get through the opening of the shutters as white specks of what I assumed was paint and dusty stuff was coming inside onto the window ledge and our bags from whatever was going on outside. The other note would be the volume on the TV only going up to a certain level before it doesn't go any higher - sometimes, hard to hear, as the highest volume setting isn't that loud.
reviews.title: Lovely Lovely Hotel Casci

likes.disliked: — It was not a room with a view...

reviews.text: Breakfast was ok, the coffee tasted great.
reviews.title: Fantastic Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend the hotel for something with good location of this standard of property. I'd bring my own towels next time though, I'd never seen towels like that before and likened them more to cotton tablecloths!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.text: This hotel is a real gem. Family run, it's 2mins walk from the heart of Florence in a beautiful atmospheric old building. Lovely, clean and well organised rooms with the added surprise of a more luxurious bath than you'd expect for the price. It has a great breakfast room with a really comprehensive spread so there's definitly something for everyone. They have a little bar if you fancy a late night drink and a read of the many guide books and novels that line their shelves. Their laundry service is quick and cheap. The staff are both helpful and friendly and this -combined with a real attention to detail- makes this hotel a wonderful place to stay.
reviews.title: A lovely stay

likes.liked: — The warm staff and the location

reviews.title: A very friendly hotel
reviews.text: We have just come back from a four night stay at the Hotel Casci and can thoroughly recommend it. The staff could not be more helpful. we've stayed in places costing twice the rate of this hotel and got nowhere near the standard of service. The location is great (5 mins from Duomo) and our room at the back of the hotel was very quiet. The rooms are small, but very clean and tidy, and have all you need for a short stay including safe and fridge. The staff speak fluent English (and I think French as well) which is very useful when it comes to recommending places to eat and visit. All in all a wonderful stay.

reviews.title: nice hotel, friendly staff
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at the Casci in October 2004. This is a nice, basic hotel in a great location, a 10 minute walk from anywhere in the old city (it is a bit trick to find but Paolo will give you directions). Our room was kind of small but very clean and the bath was reasonably sized. The bed was comfortable. The breakfast was OK and there are plenty of places to eat nearby. The hotel staff was extremely helpful and friendly (I believe it's a family affair). There was little exterior noise to speak of although there was some interior noise. This was easily masked by running the air conditioner fan.

reviews.title: Great choice
reviews.text: This hotel is a reasonable choice, reasonably priced, well located with a very friendly staff. We would stay there again!

reviews.title: Very kind and helpful
reviews.text: The hotel is not your standard American place. The rooms are small, the bathrooms smaller. But the location is great, the room was pretty quiet (for the area) and the staff could not have been more helpful.
If you are looking for a Hilton, don't try this, but if you are willing to accept smaller rooms, and some interesting quirks, try it for the location and the price.
reviews.title: Hotel Casci provides an excellent value

reviews.text: The Hotel Casci was a wonderful place to stay. My wife and sons and I thoroughly enjoyed it. The family staff was highly attentive to our needs and assured that everthing was taken care of. It is also well-located just a block and a half from the Duomo in the center of everything! If I return to Florence (and I sure hope I do!), I would definitely want to stay there again!
reviews.title: Fantastic place
Great location
reviews.text: Nice location, great internet communication, and good tour reccomendations. Buffet breakfast had lots to drink and many breads. Felt a bit rushed at times with a goal more towards efficiency verses relaxation however. Nice hotel with competent staff.

I have just returned from three nights in this hotel with my wife and can completely agree with all the other reviewers except the comments about Paulo I found him to be perfectly helpful as were all the staff the perfect location for a trip to Florence
reviews.title: Hotel Casci Highly Recommended

reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Casci for 5 nights in June 2005. There was breakfast every morning to start us on our day, and a gracious and welcoming staff. Our room was quiet, clean, and had air conditioning that worked.
reviews.title: Overall, Good Choice

reviews.text: I wish there had been a little more variety in the breakfast, but it probably helps to keep their costs down.
reviews.title: Great Hotel
Amazing hotel
reviews.text: This is a wonderful hotel and the family that runs it is very helpful. They booked our passes for Uffizi and Academia in advance. Hotel is close to Duomo. They were very helpful in helping us plan a trip to Chianti/Tuscany/Sienna. I will definitely stay here again.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Great location near Duomo and everything else, helpfull staff, nice breakfast. The room furnishings are pretty basic, as are towels/linens, but we had a pretty large, esp. by Italian standards, bathroom, with a bath/shower combo, great double-paned windows blocked out all the noise.
reviews.title: Great Location
Excellent family-run hotel
reviews.text: My wife and I recently spent four nights at this excellent hotel,

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: and it has been an unforgettable experience. The location, Via
reviews.title: Two thumbs up!
Great place to stay
reviews.text: Cavour, the room, spotlessly cleaned and serviced (fresh towels every day & everything working, including the essential air-con.), the most enjoyable breakfast, but above all, the kind and extremely attentive help given by all staff, and in particular the Lombardi family, who set a fine example for others to follow. - all these things, and many more, make it a relaxing haven to return to after a hot, busy day's sightseeing, and all so conveniently close. Just one thing - do not be put off by the rather dark street entrance. Take

reviews.title: The Florence hotel for us
reviews.text: Don't be put off by the climb up the staircase (or the lift) to the hotel's first floor entrance! The welcome was warm and the care and service first class. The hotel is clean, quiet and serves a very good breakfast. Highly recommended.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel Casci is a great hotel couple of blocks or so from the Duomo. This is a great central location and you can walk to most, if not all, of Florence's major sights from here. The staff is super friendly and accomodating. They recommended restaurants and helped us make reservations, suggested day trips and explained how to get there and also reserved tickets for us at the Uffizi and Accademia.
reviews.title: Great Hotel !!
Great Location! Great Service!
reviews.text: In short, they were wonderful and ensured we had a pleasant stay in Florence.

The hotel itself is very nice too. Our room was spacious, clean and quite. Bathroom was a little tight but not a problem. Who's in Italy for the bathroom? ;-). There was a TV with a DVD player and a safe. They had a collection of DVDs you can rent out, which we never checked out...but it is available. Plenty of books to borrow from their library too. Check-in and checkout was smooth too.
reviews.title: Can't be beat!!

reviews.text: Breakfast was great....they had assorted breads, cereal, pastries, hard-boiled eggs and fruits. (May have missed couple of more items.) . Paolo's mother-in-law, who is usually around the breakfast area in the mornings is very charming sweet lady!! And to top it off it all, they have free wi-fi throughout the hotel and a computer for public use with internet incase you dont have your laptop with you.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

likes.liked: — Helpfulness and friendliness of staff - good overall facilities and excellent breakfast.

reviews.text: The Lombardi family that runs this hotel made our time in Florence, Italy a wonderful experience for our small group of friends. They made great recommendations and helped with reservations. All of the advise was right on. The location was perfect for walking to almost everywhere. The hotel itself is quiet, clean and very comfortable. The breakfast was also very good.
reviews.title: Loved the Lombardi's

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The economical price truely made this the find of the trip.
reviews.title: True hospitality - delightful gracious hosts

reviews.text: There is a very good reason why this otherwise modest 2 star hotel in the heart of historic Florence rates so highly in these reviews.
reviews.title: Hotel Casci is outstanding

reviews.text: In these days of surly or indifferent service, the family which runs the Hotel Casci truly and genuinely care about each of their guests as if they too were members of an extended family.
reviews.title: Ideal base

reviews.text: Nothing was ever too much trouble, and I was actually embarrassed on occasion at the extent they were prepared to go in order to accommodate me.
reviews.title: Fantastic location, a very friendly service

likes.liked: — the very friendly staff and the location of the hotel

reviews.title: Very happy with the Casci
reviews.text: As a side note, we had an amazing dinner at the restaurant "Mangiafuoco Bracerie" a 5 min walk from the hotel on via Guelfa (50 euros for two people).

Our recent stay at the Hotel Casci was just excellent. The hotel is centrally located, and the room was very quiet and extremely clean. The staff were extremely helpful, and the breakfast was very good. We received some great advice from the staff on restaurants, and they helped with museum reservations.
reviews.title: Very Good Value - Would Recommend

reviews.text: I read a review that was quite critical of this hotel, and I disagree with the review entirely. This is not a 5-star property, and does not charge as such. The entrance is not as one would find at a 5-star property, but the hotel does not promote itself as such. It is a very clean, well-run and comfortable 2 or 3 star property, and charges rates accordingly. If you want a grand entrance, or expensive art in the corridors, and if you are prepared to pay for such features, then this is not the property for you.
reviews.title: Loved the Hotel Casci !!

likes.liked: — The helpulness of the owners/the large family room and fresh sheets everyday/great breakfasts

reviews.text: I would recommend this hotel to anyone travelling to Florence with a family, or on a budget, or for whom the art in the museums is more important than the decoration in the hotel entrance areas.
reviews.title: Wonderful hotel!

reviews.text: We have just spent 5 nights at the Hotel Casci and had a wonderful time. Paulo, his lovely mother and their staff are very kind and extremely helpful and nothing is too much trouble. The Family Room was large and airy and perfect for ourselves and our 2 children. The added bonus of fresh sheets and towels every day was extremely welcome after a hot day of sightseeing !The Hotel is literally a short stroll away from all the major attractions and the ample breakfasts each morning set you up for the day ahead. We would definetely stay at the Casci again and highly recommend it as a great base to explore beautiful Florence.
reviews.title: Would definitely stay here again!

reviews.text: This family run hotel was everything we wanted. The location was great as it is within walking distance to all of the sights. Paolo and his mother were absolutely wonderful. They were so helpful and made us feel as if we were part of the family. I can't sing enough praise for the staff, because they made Florence even more wonderful than I had expected. The rooms were large and comfortable. I would recommend Casci to anyone. I am already planning my return and will definitely stay at Casci.
reviews.title: A Haven of peace in a city of treasures

likes.liked: — Accommodation was Central, clean comfortable and very plesant

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My wife and I stayed at the Hotel Casci twice for a total of five nights during our stay in Italy and were very satisfied. The hotel is within walking distance of just about every attraction in the city and a number of reasonably priced restaurants -- for Florence -- are only a few blocks away. The rooms were plain but clean and comfortable. All the equipment worked and there was plenty of hot water. There was free Internet access from a computer in the lobby. What made this hotel stand out, though, was the attentive and friendly service. We took up the hotel staff's offer to make reservations at two popular museums, saving us hours of waiting in lines. The hotel also reconfirmed our return air reservations, held some of our luggage between our two stays, arranged a taxi to the airport for an early morning departure, and gave us a continental breakfast well before the usual breakfast hours to accommodate our early departure. Most of these services were offered before we could ask. We would definitely stay here again.
reviews.title: Excellent location, Great Service
Hotel Casci
reviews.text: Hotel Casci is a small family run hotel in Florence, well located and convenient to the Duomo and other sites. The staff was a joy to deal with, no request was too small or too much trouble for them. Their restaurant suggestions were wonderful and their customer service was excellent. This was a our first stay in Florence and Hotel Casci was the perfect location. We spent five nights and highly recommend this hotel to future travelers.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel in the centre of Florence for a couple of nights. It's a minute's walk from the Duomo so not cheap but very welcoming and homely. The staff could not have been more friendly and helpful, and they went out of their way to make our stay pleasant without being in any way intrusive. There's no restaurant, but no shortage of good bars and restaurants nearby and the hotel's recommendations can be relied on. They also have a huge range of up to date reference and guide books and you can have free use of the internet. Don't be put off by the peeling stucco outside, and the entrance hall from the street and the lift which look a little basic - once you reach the second floor reception it's all light and pleasant and surprisingly quiet for that location. We would certainly stay there again.
reviews.title: Friendly and welcoming

likes.liked: — More like a home than a hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed at the Hotel Casci on the first 2 nights of our 2 week trip. It was a perfect location, allowing us to get out quickly to see the sights, and make easy visits back for a rest or to freshen up. The staff are absolutely lovely. We had a bit of a "crisis" and were frantically awaiting a package to be delivered from home; they were exceptionally accommodating and helpful, even when I'm sure we were driving them nuts. The breakfasts were some of the best we had throughout our trip. The room was a reasonable size, and the bathroom was quite large compared to our other stays. The entire hotel was spotless.
reviews.title: Great location, perfectly nice hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our only complaint - and this is a really odd one - is that our room smelled of what we could only describe as cabbage. Our room was towards the back of the hotel, and the smell became evident the further back you walked. We never determined if it was the water and dampness in the room if we didn't leave our windows open (our guess), our someone in the courtyard with a deep love of boiled cabbage. Like I said, very odd. It certainly wouldn't keep us from staying there again. It's also become kind of a fun joke that we still mention.
reviews.title: Loved Hotel Casci

reviews.text: Following a recommendation from a friend I decided to give this hotel a try - WELL - what a gem it turned out to be and the friend who recommended it to me is a friend for life. The hotel is ideally located in the centre of this historic city, ideally placed for sightseeing. It was spotlessly clean, the management and staff really did everything to make the experience a home from home. I can't wait to return to this beautiful city and would definitely stay there again
reviews.title: Hotel Casci what a Gem

likes.liked: — Attention to detail. clean and comfortable

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Not as close to the train station as we would have liked, but it was easy to get to by bus (which we did take). Very informative Web site, including directions how to get to hotel.
reviews.title: Okay hotel...staff was great....

likes.liked: — Hotel staff was very friendly, spoke English, and very helpful

reviews.title: Very good all round
reviews.text: Room was okay; small, bathroom small, but clean, so that was good. Breakfast was okay--coffee was surprisingly good (not espresso, regular coffee).

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Very friendly and helpful hotel staff.
reviews.title: Friendly place in a busy city

likes.disliked: — Doesn't look like much from the street, but looks are deceiving.

reviews.text: Complimentary Internet access, which was great, to check e-mails (naturally). Also, they had available for sale, bottled watter and snacks, which was great!
reviews.title: Great little hotel in the heart of Florence

likes.liked: — A+ friendly and helpful staff, great location
likes.disliked: — The tile floors in the rooms were lovely, but my children kept slipping!

reviews.text: Family-run small hotel within walking distance to all major sights. Our room (no 3 on the front) was quiet - good double-glazing and traffic is restricted in centre anyway. Breakfast was good and we had the opportunity to talk to others on 4 seater tables. Both the owners and their manager, Pierpaolo, were extremely helpful with directions, bookings, suggestions etc.
reviews.title: Central, friendly and quiet

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Good value too.
reviews.title: Like being at home

likes.liked: — The way the personal treat the guest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While I was looking for a hotel to stay as a part of our honey moon in Florence I founded very good reviews in tripadvisor.com about hotel Casci, but what surprised me the most was the price everybody said they payed.
reviews.title: Very enjoyable & comfortable!

likes.liked: — Friendly, well located, good food for breakfast, service.

reviews.title: Great Place for Personal Service
reviews.text: At first I tough it was a part of a promotion or something like that because is hard to find a hotel that gives the kind of service it does for the price the charge.
I found out in their webpage and confirm it was cheap.
reviews.title: Great hospitality

likes.disliked: — Cramming all the luggage in the tiny lift

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: What can we say? Convenient and Fantastic location, clean comfortable rooms, great breakfast, personable and knowledgeable staff who we perplexed with an off the wall request for a good Enoteca nearby, which turned out to be our best dinner out of the whole trip.
reviews.title: Grazie Casci

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: When we realized we left our annotated guidebook for our whole trip on the plane, they were more than happy to lend us one of theirs (they have huge library...) and make recommendations for us. Reservations for both restaurants and museums were handled quickly and efficiently as were recommendtaions when to go and in what order; all without making you feel it was an annoyance or imposition.
reviews.title: Excellent Choice!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
